meanings.definition: Lack of restraint in spending money or using resources.
meanings.sent1: Her extravagancy with shopping often left her with empty pockets.
meanings.sent2: The company's extravagancy on unnecessary office decorations led to financial issues.
meanings.sent3: Despite her extravagancy, she always managed to find great deals.
meanings.sent4: His extravagancy in buying gifts for everyone made him the most popular person in the office.
meanings.sent5: The extravagancy of the royal family was known far and wide.

meanings.sent1: The extravagancy of buying designer clothes every week was unsustainable.
meanings.sent2: The government's extravagancy on luxury trips raised concerns among the citizens.
meanings.sent3: His extravagancy on pet accessories was both amusing and endearing.
meanings.sent4: Her extravagancy in redecorating her house every month was like a never-ending project.
meanings.sent5: The extravagancy of the party decorations made the event unforgettable.

meanings.definition: An extravagant or lavish act or idea.
meanings.sent1: The proposal was an extravagancy that took everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent2: The extravagancy of the wedding ceremony impressed all the guests.
meanings.sent3: His extravagancy in planning themed parties always brought joy to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The extravagancy of the art installation left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent5: The extravagancy of the dessert buffet was a feast for the eyes.
